physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance score 1; Karnofsky performance scale score 90; abdomen soft, no tenderness, distention, or organomegaly; skin of the right arm with scars and chronic superficial thromboses; remainder of examination normal.

Oral mucosa erythematous with ulcerations; jugular vein distended; jugular venous pressure 10-12 cm of water; breath sounds decreased at right lung base; abdomen distended, slightly firm, with tenderness to percussion and guarding in right lower quadrant, and tenderness in left lower quadrant; 3+ pitting edema to the sacrum.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weight increased from 98 kg to 108 kg; worsening of oral mucosa with ulcerations and erythema, worsening abdominal tenderness.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient appeared uncomfortable and inattentive; repeat CT showed no substantial change; persistent fevers, abdominal distention continues; signs of peritonitis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Temperature rose to 40.6°C; clinical status worsened with persistent abdominal distention and peritonitis.
